title: Fundamentals of Real-Time Fault Detection Technology for High-Speed Rail Traction Electromechanical Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics (algebra, statistics) and foundational understanding of physics mechanics
context.additional_context: Blended education combining smartphone-based mobile learning with offline practical training, focusing on foundational mathematical modeling and data analysis

learning_goals: Learners can explain and classify three or more major failure types in high-speed rail electromechanical systems.
Learners can perform failure signal analysis procedures using wavelet packet decomposition and energy distribution calculations.
Learners can apply time-domain statistical analysis and feature vector extraction methods based on simulation data.
Learners can mathematically model and interpret real-world fault detection scenarios through project-based assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
